transcript.content: Okay, let's have a great show, everyone.
Oh, yeah. Good luck.
Good luck.
Good luck to you all.

Right, that was Jane's Addiction just because on Xfm 104.9. Right, everybody up. Let's give 'em a great show. Yeah. Two hours of like, fun chat. Let's keep it, you know, let's keep it cutting edge. That's not gonna be too, I mean, that's what the listeners of Xfm would oh no, it isn't, is it? No, because hold on, wait a minute. Because we came in yesterday and did this little skit, didn't we? Where we bleeped it out.
A little sketch. It was quite naughty, quite controversial.
And then Karl called me last night and we're not allowed to play it out cos um...
Oh it's, but we've been censored.
Yeah. Uhh, has yeah.
Interesting. Interesting. So it's a cutting edge alternative station. Wants to push the boundaries. Wants to be thought of as rock and roll. A bit punk a bit punk rock.
Yeah. Yeah.
But we're not allowed to play stuff...
Yeah. Cos I, cos I, cos I umm. Uhh...I said something about the radio authority. I bleeped it out while I called 'em.
Sure. Yeah.
But uhh, couldn't do it. Done it before.
Not allowed. Censored.
Couldn't do it.
Censored. Noo.
Karl agrees thought. What's your thoughts Karl, you agree with that?
Yeah, I agree, yeah.
Why?
Well, what's the point?
Well, it was funny wasn't it? And it wasn't offensive.
Not, not really. It's not some of the best stuff that would have ever gone out on this show. But...you know.
Right, what are you putting it up against exactly?
Ricky laughs
Cheeky freak of the week?
Well, that, that springs to mind.
Yeah. Rockbusters?
But I mean...
Yeah.

The thing is, you know, the things you have put out there, I mean we better be really careful. He was worried about complaints, I mean, it's not just swearing is it. It's taste and decency and everything.
Hmm. Yeah.
So, we can't, we can't laugh about the disabled anymore.
No.
In the cheeky freak of the weak.
Hmm.
Uhh...can't do stories about elderly relatives with genitals looking like split tennis ball.
That's right.
Can't do your bad, Dad putting a child with learning difficulties in a bin. So, what should we just play music?
I think that's all it's gonna have to be, yeah.
Play a record.
You Seriously think you'd lose the license for that sketch?
Well.
Does he really seriously think you'd -
Well I don't know but -
- lose the license for it? It's, it is not the worst thing we've ever put out or done or ever will do.
Yeah, but it's the fact that he said, don't put it out and you're like, you know, throwing your toys out the pram.
Ricky laughs
No we're -
"Oh I want, I want to say it, I want to say it" how old are you? But you still want to put swearing out.
No, it's a discussion about the radio authority and the way people are interested.
Yeah, but leave it let's move on.
Don't get annoyed.
Yeah but I'm annoyed because you've been at it since about half past twelve.
Ricky laughs
Yeah I know. Well I like, I like to get in early to plan the show.
Yeah, but there's been no planning. So to be honest, I'd turn off today, anyone listening, cause there's nothing.
Ricky laughs
Karl, there's never anything.
Ricky laughs
There is, there's sometimes some good things but today, seriously, I'd I'd leave it.
What is it, what is there, what - name us something half decent that's been on this show.
Load of little interesting topics that -
Go on, I can't remember any.
Right, gays in toilets.
Yeah.
Hmm, not particularly interesting. Fascinating to you, perhaps.
Right, well I'd prefer to hear that then just a load of swear words.
Well a lot of people would find that offensive.
We're not going, we wouldn't have heard any swear words, we would have heard some bleeping.
Right then, so that's, that's entertaining init. A load of bleeps.
That's just because you don't wanna stand up to your boss or say anything - don't get annoyed.
I'd stand, I'd stand up tall if if I agree with what I'm arguing about, but I'm not falling out with him over some crappy thing you wanna play out.
Don't say "crappy"
Don't slag it off.
Don't say "crappy"
Well it doesn't matter because I'm not here next week -
Don't -
- I'll tell you that. I've canned this in, alright.
Don't say "crappy"
So if Andrew is listening -
Don't say "crappy"
- someone else can be in next week.
Play a record. We apologize for the word "crap"
That's out of order, we should've bleep that.
Thrills - Big Sur
Big Sur, the Thrills on Xfm 104.9 started off another nice atmosphere again in the studio.
Don't blame me. It's not my fault.
No, I know I know.
Well, it's your fault mainly.
Mm, Yeah.
You are bad, you are quite bad.
But don't, come on, don't.
Nah, come on you are.
Don't try and win him round just cause he's scared you. Brawwwk!
Steve laughs
I don't know who's that against, is it me or him? I don't know now.
That's you, yeah. It's you.
Brawwwk!
Brawwwk!
Right, ahh well I'm not a coward.
No.
I'm not a coward.
Ok.
I'm, I'm just thinking of the listeners, Rick, and I just want them to be entertained.
Yeah. Luckily that's not a big problem for us.
Steve and Ricky laugh
What, you mean we're effortlessly entertaining or there're no listeners?
Well, yeah, somewhere somewhere in between.
Yeah.
Karl, what's happened to you this week, mate?
Nowts happened.
Steve and Ricky laugh
Come on -
Nothings happened?

Come on, I came in I came in and he had an hour lunch break, you know how he's talking about how he never gets a break. I came in one day, he was out for an hour and I had a nice little chat with Andrew Phillips about, you know, where we're going with the show and - you know.
Where are we going with it? You come up with anything?
Ricky laughs
Ah, dear.
Steve laughs
Is it how far we can run it into the ground?
Yeah, no, if we go off air it certainly won't be through ah being cutting edge or controversial you know because people will have just turned off because it's too boring to listen to.
Brawwk!
Brawwk! Um, but uh he was out for an hour.
Having a lunch break for an hour -
I know.
- and he's always saying he's too busy.
I know. yeah.
It is interesting.
Ricky mumbles

I got, actually, on the subject of that, I noticed Dan here is emailed and he says, "I was listening to last week's show and I think Karl has taken his job for granted. I'd love to swap with him for a week. My qualifications are that I can press play on a CD player -
Ricky laughs
- and stop"
Karl
What do you think of that?
He can come in next week. Seriously.
It says here he -
Don't get ratty, Karl. We're just entertaining.
I'm not being ratty. Dan email me, you know my address. Email it, it'll be sorted out. You can be here next week.
Ricky laughs
Dan suggested we could call it Karl Idol, where people audition each week. Or perhaps Bone Idol, might be more appropriate.
I like that, Bone Idol.
Brilliant.
Ricky laughs
Have we, have you got a Monkey News Karl?
Uh, don't know, I couldn't be bothered.
Ricky laughs
Play a record. Play a record.
Pretenders - Kid
Pretenders and -
Steve hohoos
- Kid.
Oh dear. Hi five. Hi five.
- on Xfm 104.9.
Hi five.
That's professionalism init?
Yeah, that is unbelievable. Ricky, you were - I mean I don't know if I can describe it, really, the scene
Yeah.
You were going mental.
Yeah.
You were shouting. You were really being quite an unpleasant character.
Well, it's cause -
Then the mics come and Rick you're absolutely -
Funny, init?
You're a charmer.
Funny, funny how people get annoyed -
Karl.
- about certain different manners.

Karl said that uh we didn't have to be here next week if Andrew gets annoyed. I was going, I went this is entertainment. He pays us to entertain. We haven't done anything against the law yet, have we? Or offensive, or against the radio authority. Karl said "crap" but I think we'll get away with that.
Yeah.
So what is there to worry about? Exactly.
Alright, let's just draw a line under the beginning of the show, seriously.
Yeah, let's start again. Now come on, come on.
Can we just hug and make up? Can we just have a big kiss?
Yeah.
Yeah.
Come on. No, don't do that. Just. Karl, what have you got?
What's on the list?
Ricky laughs
We've done swearing, we've done swearing. That's that's sorted out.
Well no your point was more that you, weren't you interested in why swearing people find it offensive?
Yeah, a little bit.
Cause that seems obvious to me.
Cause you, cause you were saying yesterday that you don't that you never understood why people find it offensive, weren't you?
That's right, that's right.
Yeah.
But you, I know.
Well carry on.
Yeah, but that's what I was saying to you, why you can't do it on the radio, because people find it offensive for some reason. I don't agree with it, but some people do.
Yeah I know
I'm saying everyone swears.
Bleep it out I would.
But I'm, this is the thing -
Bleep it out, bleep it out. That's my, that's my theory.
But you say that everyone swears, not everyone does swear. I don't know why you've got this in your head that everyone swears.
I'm convinced. Everyone.
What, everyone? Like, you know, religious people, religious leaders.
The Pope.
Jesus, I bet Jesus swore.
Ricky snorts
Right. What's your evidence for that?
No I'm just thinking, I mean things are better now then they were back then, right?
Right.
He's wondering about in His sandals getting pebbles stuck in there and stuff.
Steve laughs
And that's annoying. Nails in His hand, that must have hurt. What I'm saying is -
Right, that's offensive.
No, it's not though.
That's, that's blasphemous.
No, but what I'm -
Don't laugh at, don't laugh at the Crucifixion. Play a record.
I'm not, I'm not laughing at that though.
That is terrible.
I'm just saying -
Are you going to shoot off Rick?
No, you can email in um if you want to complain. Karl -
Yeah?
Dot Pilkington at Xfm.co.uk.
Wasn't offensive though. I'm just saying it's a fact. When you stub your little toe, you let out a little effing and jeffing.
And what do you think He -
Steve laughs
- you might hear some effing and jeffing? So, the kind of ancient Hebrew version of effing and jeffing.
Oo, I'm worried about this.
Yeah.
I'm worried about this. This is naughty.
No it's not.
Yeah it is, just - oo - I'm worried about this.
When did you start swearing?
I -
I started swearing at school.
Right.
I hope . . . you haven't offended any Christians.
Right there was a lad at at my school right who ah got caught swearing. I mean I got caught and I got
When you say you got caught? How-- What was it? You were right behind the bike shed having a swear?
"You got any of them Fs?" "No, I've only got one 'C' left it's me dad's." "Oh, come on, let's have a go on it! Let's say "-unt".
Yeah
Let me say the "-unt".
Can you go to older kids to buy you some swearing?
Just smoke it down to the "cu-"
Yeah. So you're riding your bike, having a swear
Yeah.
And teacher hears him say the 'S' word.
The 'S' word
The 'S' word?

Yeah. So the way this teacher dealt with it, he said, "Right, it's not a clever word to use" And he tried to make him get sick of using it by he had to write an essay using that word 300 times. Right?
Yeah. I would have loved that.
But that's just practice for a kid
But that is like that is like the the father catching the kid with a cigar.
And make him smoke it
And make him smoke it, yeah, yeah. Doesn't work with heroin, if you've got a young teenager who's jacked up for the first time, it can be dangerous!
The funny thing is though, right, his mom found his textbook
Of course!
Thought he was depressed and wanted to take him counseling. Because everything was 'S'. He was writing down this is--
And did it work? Did it wean him out of it?
No it didn't. The teacher I mean, he disappeared. He got kicked out for hitting a kid on the head with a bit of wood.
It wasn't you, was it? That would explain a lot.
Ricky laughs
Song fades in
Longview - 'Further'. That's great, that.
Good tune. Can I just say a big shout out, Rick
Go on
To John K. He's listening online in Los Angeles. City of Angels.
Brilliant.
It's his first time listening to the show. Who knows what he's making of it. I wonder if we should explain what Karl is to him.
He's up early.
Well, he's got up apparently to record it and then he's gone back to bed.
All right, so he can listen it any time. Oh, yeah
Exactly.
Karl...
Can you explain what he is?
He's a little bit of a grumpy, spoiled, lazy prat at the moment, but usually he's quite a funny, nice, sort of genuine guy who's in awe of the world if it's furry and doesn't really care if it isn't.
Anyway, we're all one big happy family.
Come on, Karl. Attitude up. Happy! If we're happy, the listener is happy.

We were talking about schools. Swearing. Kids at school. I just remember at school, a lot of my friends now are becoming teachers. And I just can't imagine what it must be like in an environment with kids. Because when we were at school-- I mean, not particularly me, but lots of people in the class, and you'd all end up doing it, we would just treat teachers like they weren't humans, like they were just creatures from another planet
Well, kids are cruel, because-- Yeah.
They were allowed to be tormented.
It's a game, isn't it? To see if I can wind someone up to distraction.
But is it because--
Unless you grow out of that (laughs)
Not everyone.
Especially if they got a bit cash in their pocket now and a little bit of success, they tend to think that that gives them license to treat people badly, it's terrible.
Ricky is giggling

But I remember there was a guy, - this is such a terrible story - There was a teacher, he came in and he was teaching us, and one kid, one of the hard nuts, he'd found out that this this guy, he lived on his own and he had a cat, and the cat got run over. And so we got in early, like everyone was in early and before the teacher came in, and this kid drew a picture of a cat being run over by a car in chalk on the blackboard, a huge picture of it. And the teacher just came in, saw it burst into tears and ran out. And the thing is, that was like the beginning of term, so he could never get us back back after that. There was never going to be any respect for him
Because he cried, I know yeah.
It's just like-- I just remembered now, thinking about it, just thinking-- I mean, at the time I remember thinking it was bad, but now it's just heartbreaking. It's devastating.
I know. They just forget, they'd let their guard down a little bit.
Did you ever do the one where you just... (hums). Just humming.
Ricky & Steve hums
Yeah.
And he'd tell us to stop it. And then everyone would just... (hums)

There was one teacher me and my mate used to go up to, and when he was just talking to another one, just sort of sniff him slightly and then sort of like he goes "What?" I go "Nothing!" And he'd just walk away sniffing his armpit.
But those kind of mind games! It's like
I know.

Once, right? I was talking about this in the week actually, we had this teacher and he must have been sort of like sort of 60 then, and we're all about sort of like twelve. We had to do French. You had to put your thing on the booth. And it was-- I told you this haven't I? "Le chats sur..." (mumbles in French)
What does that mean?

"Cats on the wall", right? And you'd repeat it in French. And of course everyone was going: F.C. Just like-- just for fun. And he heard this and he listened back to all of them and he realized, and he went mental. He went "I don't believe this! Do you know how much these cost?" He was going mad, he was going red and bursting like Karl was earlier. And it was like "I just I can't stand this anymore!" And he picked up an exercise, and he said, "Look at this exercise book! Look!" And I won't say the kids name, he went "So and so, Look! Oh, look! Oh, look! He's put..." and I'll change his name. 'Smithers'. "Oh, look, he's put Smithers is shit! Oh! Oh! He's got clever on this side! He's put 'Smithers' is a lump of shit, that's good!" Right? And he went berserk. He went "Oh, look, he's drawn a picture of a penis with wings and he's written underneath 'Dicky Bird'". He went "Is that clever?!" He went "You want me to put a piece of paper up so you can come and write swear words and draw ladies genitals all day?" And I went (laughs) laughing. He went "I'm glad you think it's funny, Mr. Gervais!" And he stormed out.
Oh, god!
Yeah.
And did he ever come back?
No, but we put the bit of paper up for him and said, look what we've done you Sir: "That's a fanny. There's some knobs" Yeah?
Was it biology?.
No, it was French.

Oh, French, of course. I just remember things like games. Like there was some covers at the back of the math class, and one kid just got in the cupboard before the teacher came and then sat in there for like, you know, 45 minutes and just towards the end of the thing, just came out.
Brilliant.
Just came out and just went, "Ohhh" And sat down and just things like that, which just kind of-- I don't know what it is. It's just an utter lack of respect.

I played a trick like that once in my first year at college. This is pathetic, right? On a hall of residence, right? And there was this woman, sort of middle aged woman, come around in a twinset, and I think she was from a bank, where she's doing students going to do a bank account. And she was coming down the corridor and she's knocked, right? And so my mate got in my wardrobe in this little room, right? Just sat there. She came in and... (mumbles) ...and there was a knock on the wardrobe, I went: "Come in!" And he just came out, I went "Alright?" And he left. And she just looked at me and I started laughing. I went "Sorry" She went "You're not interested?" I went "No"
Steve laughs
But she just fell flat. She fell flat (laughing)
Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Karl, a little bit happier now?
Yeah. I'm happy
Ricky & Steve humming
Ricky is being incredibly annoying
What have you done this week?
Doesn't bother me, that.
No, what have you done this week?
Doesn't bother me, that.
No! Karl, answer the question. You're the producer. What have you done this week?
A few things.

It's funny, right, because when he's moaning about-- I'd caught him out! He says he doesn't get a lunch break, he'd had over an hour... And then he went, I think he went quite early that night to get a hob or something. And I said to-- Was James Hyman, was it, wasn't he?
Yeah, that's right.
And I said... "James, he's always complaining about working. Does he work hard?" And he went "Well... He doesn't work as hard as he used to..."
Play a record Karl, will you?
Hmmm Interesting.
I don't really want to hit the start button now, I might do it in a bit. A bit lazy.

I'm not saying you're lazy! I'm saying that you know, maybe some people don't think you work as hard as you do. That's the way of the world. I'm not saying you don't work hard! Just reporting speech, really, on James Hyman? Calling him a liar?! Play a record!
Karl whispering
Can't be bothered...
Play a record Karl!
Song fades in
Ricky & Steve humming
I reckon we could do this all the way through Billy Bragg
Play a record. Let's not-- Let's not ruin-- It's not Billy Bragg's fault.
No, just off air, for Karl
He's written some good tunes, old Billy Bragg, that's one of them.
Yeah.
'Waiting for the Great Leap Forward'
What station are we on?
Yeah, with Karl Pilkington. Karl, what do you think of it so far?
What? Of what? Just today?
Well, you weren't up for it innit and now it's turned out great in your are you you little bit happier?
Yeah.
Yeah?
Yeah, it's good, yeah.
Good.
Just talking earlier about teachers, weren't you, if you got any amusing anecdotes about teachers or anything around that subject?
I didn't go at school that much.
Go on
When I did-- I was telling to Suzanne about the other day how, you know, she goes out with me now and she thinks I'm, you know, I'm great. She's lucky, what she's got and stuff.
Steve laughs
No no, she's done well, right?
Yeah
But I was the sort of kid who she would have hated at school because I never had, like, a pen.
Oh, yeah, I know what the sort you are. Never a pencil case or any stuff?
I'd start off the term, I would, and I was like a brand new carrier bag with me stuff in.
A brand new carrier bag! Classy
Yeah, classy
Well, you got to have something to put the stuff you've nicked from Woolworth in, haven't you?
Right? So that'd be there, but then by the time, like a couple of weeks down, I'd put my pen down, I would have lost it. And then I'm sort of going around saying "Can I borrow a pen?"
You didn't try to stick it up your nose? It's not still lodged up there?
No, no. But the funny thing with like, you know, you were talking about teachers and stuff
Were you disruptive? Were you a disruptive kid?
No, not really. I was one of them
No, he wouldn't cause troubles! He's terrified of the boss here, isn't he?
No, it's not that. It's just that what's the point in winding people up? I find it quite annoying if people do that
Ricky giggles
So I don't wish it up on anyone else.
Why'd you wind Steve up then sometimes?
I don't wind him.
You do. You have done. But come on, let's not argue! We were getting on well then, come on, Karl!
And like the teachers-- because I've lived on this estate, right? Loads of stuff used to get nicked and go missing and what have you.
Blackboards... Desks...
And their way-- No, like telly and the video and stuff like that. And the projector thing and all that. So the way they used to try and find it -my little conspiracy- as you know, I'm good at that.
Yeah.

What they used to do is set your homework and say, right, draw like a bird's eye view of your house, right? But draw everything you've got in your house as well. So if you've got - I don't know - if you've got anything in the loft, make sure you draw it.
Right, so people with kids would come in with overhead projectors.
Well, that was the idea.
Ricky and Steve laugh.
Chalk. Guns. Anti-aircraft guns in the shed.
So your-the picture you did for your home presumably...
Got nothing from me.
Nothing.
He used to hand it, in empty house "I'm not a grass". Nor are the illegal immigrants living in the kitchen.
Just a picture of your Auntie Nora.
Yeah. What's that? Have you been stealing tennis balls?
No, that's not a split tennis ball. That's my Auntie Nora's ffff...
Yeah, but what about all the stuff? Didn't you have to draw the stuff that your father had nicked?
Ricky laughs.
Listen, we're doing songs of Phrase today because Rock Busters has gone
What songs of phrase again? I can't remember. I don't think I'd like to out.
Yeah.
When we do something that's been said a few times on the show, right?
Been said a few times. Bwark! I'm scared of Andrew Phillips. Bwark! [inaudible] Go on. Sorry, you were speaking, Karl.
So we take a phrase from the show, right, and just get songs... like the words from the songs, edit them together,
Something like BWARK!
Something like that.
Yeah. Okay. Sorry. Go on, go on. Sorry go on Karl. Go on.
Ricky laughs.
So are we doing it?
So what's the phrase you've come up with?
How do you spell "bwark!"
A phrase is "no more cheeky freak of the week".
"No more cheeky freak of the week". We don't have that anymore.

Well, no, because it's offensive. And if we're worried about offending people to talk about people with disabilities, like conjoined twins and women who are born with deformed legs, you call a "dog woman", so you've got to be careful. You've already insulted Christ. Let's not do disability. Let's do songs of phrase, shall we?
Cheeky Freak of the Week was never out to offend anyone. No, it wasn't to make you [inaudible].
We don't try and offend people. We try and entertain them. Bwark!

Right. Do you know, the funny thing is you know, the funny thing is, right, you're being cruel about people and stuff. It goes on all the time on the News the other night, you know, those Siamese twins that didn't make it through the operation? And this is why I'm stopping it. Because I don't want people to think we're having a go at disabled people and stuff, right, on the news, right?
Yes.
Before that operation, the doctor said, "we're going to try and sort this out". All the doctors are going to get their heads together. Is that a good phrase to use?
Yeah.
See what I'm saying?
Karl (dissapointed). Play record. Play a record.
I'm just.
Ohh.
Are you offended, Rick? Are you offended, Rick? Ah, you've offended Ricky Gervais.
You're the one thats-bwark-that's...
Yeah but I'm saying we're not out to offend anyone yet. Yet it's always going on. People are always having a go.
We're trying to entertain. Please don't bring it down. Play a record.
I hate him. I hate him, I HATE HIM.
The Darkness - Growing on Me
Darkness - growing on me.
You love the darkness, don't you?
Yeah.
I was lucky enough to see them at that HMV thing

I know, I was as well... It's a bit, it's a bit too jokey, or a bit too tongue in cheek, but it isn't really. If you don't know that, it sounds great. It just sounds like sort of retro 70s rock. That's great. Brilliant.
It's nice to have rock back, I think you'll agree.
Big time.
Yeah. High five man!
Yeah yeah yeah. Sweet!
Sweet, sweet, sweet. Songs of Phrase. It's the mighty return of Songs of Phrase. No one has requested that! It's not due to public opinion.
A lot of people have requested some swearing.
They have indeed
Lot of emails for that. But go on, Karl.
Ricky giggles
And remind us again what exacyl Songs of Phrase is, and why we should care?
It's just a phrase that we take from the show, make up by taking words out of a song, edit it together. Right? The phrase that we're doing is "No more cheeky freak of the week!"
"No more cheeky freak of the weak"
It sounds like this.
Right? So
Now that's not all impossible.
Play again. Play again, I didn't hear that
You got to email in with all the songs that you can hear there. Right? There's five songs
And we just want the names of the songs?
Yeah, that'll do.
Okay.
Alright?
Can we just hear it again?
It's good. It's probably one of the best you've done. It's very tricky, though.
That's not too tricky. Play it again.
How many of you got, do you think, Rick?
Well, I've noticed the same person singing twice
Is that right, Karl?
In a band, on solo.
Yeah
And I know one straight away, just from the word.
Can I just say, I do think naming the songs is a bit tricky. Let's just name the artists. Is that all right?
Just the artist?

Just the artists, changed the rule slightly. Before we play it again, just let you know what the prizes are: We've got on DVD 'Later...With Jools Holland: Louder'. Lots of the alternative axes had on there a DVD. There are a couple of DVDs.
Brilliant. With Boogie Woogie Piano over the top.
(laughs) Let's hope so!
I can't wait!

Jesus and Mary Chain on there, Stereophonics, we got Sonic Youth, Ash, Hole, Queens of the Stone Age, Foo Fighters, quite good. Once again, Cruise of the Gods on DVD, starring Rob Bryden and Steve Coogan, that was on at Christmas, it's not bad.
It's not the same one! They haven't been sending that back. We've been giving out different ones each week.
We have indeed. This is an album just called quite simply, 'I Love You'. And you'll be pleased because there's the likes of Mel C, Cliff Richard and The Hollies on there.
Brilliant.

Excellent. The 'Best Chill Out Album Ever'. We've got The Beach Boys on there, Elvis Costello, Pink Floyd, Coldplay. That's not bad. trivia.description: Chris Steele MBE is a British medical doctor and broadcaster. He is the resident doctor on ITV's This Morning daytime magazine show, where he has appeared weekly since the show first aired in 1988.
